intro: Galium garipense, commonly known as the narrowleaf bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its small white flowers appear in clusters and bloom from late spring to early summer. Galium garipense is characterized by its opposite, narrow leaves and is often found in shaded or partially shaded environments.
